interface.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Call.Content.DRAFT
interface.tp:docstring: This object represents one Content inside a Call. For example in an audio/video call there would be one audio and one video content. Each content has one or more Stream.DRAFT objects which represent the actual transport to one or more contacts.

method.name: Remove
method.tp:docstring: Remove the content from the call.

tp:error.name: org.freedesktop.Telepathy.Error.NotImplemented
tp:error.tp:docstring: Raised when a Call doesn't support removing contents (e.g. a Google Talk video call)

tp:docstring.p: The name of the content. [FIXME: rationale?]
The media type of this content

tp:enumvalue.tp:docstring: The content has no specific disposition

tp:docstring.p: The content was initially part of the call. When Accept is called on the channel, all streams of this content where the self-handle's sending state in Senders is Sending_State_Pending_Send will be moved to Sending_State_Sending as if SetSending(TRUE) had been called.

property.name: Disposition
property.tp:docstring: The disposition of this content. This property cannot change.

tp:docstring.p: Emitted when a stream is added to a call
Emitted when a stream is added to a call
The list of Stream.DRAFT objects that exist in this content.

tp:rationale.p: In a conference call multiple parties can share one media content (say, audio), but the streaming of that media can either be shared or separate. For example, in a multicast conference all contacts would share one stream, while in a Muji conference there would be a stream for each participant.

tp:docstring.p: Change notification is via StreamAdded and StreamRemoved.
